trans-unit.source: Contains information about a portion of the format string that defines a callback field within a date and time picker (DTP) control

seg-source.mrk: Contains information about a portion of the format string that defines a callback field within a date and time picker (DTP) control

target.mrk: Contains information about a portion of the format string that defines a callback field within a date and time picker (DTP) control

trans-unit.source: Contains information about a notification message.

seg-source.mrk: Contains information about a notification message.

target.mrk: Contains information about a notification message.

trans-unit.source: Pointer to a null terminated string that defines the control callback field. The string comprises one or more "X" characters.

seg-source.mrk: Pointer to a null terminated string that defines the control callback field.
The string comprises one or more "X" characters.

target.mrk: Pointer to a null terminated string that defines the control callback field.
The string comprises one or more "X" characters.

trans-unit.source: The date and time to be formatted.

seg-source.mrk: The date and time to be formatted.

target.mrk: The date and time to be formatted.

trans-unit.source: Pointer to a null terminated string that contains the display text of the control. By default, this is the address of the Display member of this structure.

seg-source.mrk: Pointer to a null terminated string that contains the display text of the control.
By default, this is the address of the Display member of this structure.

target.mrk: Pointer to a null terminated string that contains the display text of the control.
By default, this is the address of the Display member of this structure.

trans-unit.source: It is acceptable to have pDisplay point to an existing string. In this case, you don't need to assign a value to Display.

seg-source.mrk: It is acceptable to have pDisplay point to an existing string.
In this case, you don't need to assign a value to Display.

target.mrk: It is acceptable to have pDisplay point to an existing string.
In this case, you don't need to assign a value to Display.

trans-unit.source: However, the string that pDisplay points to must remain valid until another $DTN_FORMAT notification is sent or until the control is destroyed.

seg-source.mrk: However, the string that pDisplay points to must remain valid until another $DTN_FORMAT notification is sent or until the control is destroyed.

target.mrk: However, the string that pDisplay points to must remain valid until another $DTN_FORMAT notification is sent or until the control is destroyed.

trans-unit.source: 64 character buffer that is to receive the null terminated string that the control will display.

seg-source.mrk: 64 character buffer that is to receive the null terminated string that the control will display.

target.mrk: 64 character buffer that is to receive the null terminated string that the control will display.

trans-unit.source: It is not necessary to fill the entire buffer.

seg-source.mrk: It is not necessary to fill the entire buffer.

target.mrk: It is not necessary to fill the entire buffer.

trans-unit.source: It carries the string that defines the callback field and contains a buffer to receive the string that will be displayed in the callback field.

seg-source.mrk: It carries the string that defines the callback field and contains a buffer to receive the string that will be displayed in the callback field.

target.mrk: It carries the string that defines the callback field and contains a buffer to receive the string that will be displayed in the callback field.

trans-unit.source: This structure is used with the $DTN_FORMAT notification message.

seg-source.mrk: This structure is used with the $DTN_FORMAT notification message.

target.mrk: This structure is used with the $DTN_FORMAT notification message.
